text: Tahar Ben Hassine Mansouri (born 9 January 1965 in Fouchana, Tunis) is a retired Tunisian marathon runner. ==Achievements== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |1992 |Pan Arab Games |Latakia, Syria |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |Marathon |2:21:52 |- |rowspan=2|1993 |Mediterranean Games |Narbonne, France |8th |Marathon |2:21:02 |- |World Championships |Stuttgart, Germany |9th |Marathon |2:18:54 |- |1994 |Jeux de la Francophonie |Paris, France |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |Marathon |2:17:18 |- |1995 |World Championships |Gothenburg, Sweden |24th |Marathon |2:20:44 |- |1996 |Olympic Games |Atlanta, United States |26th |Marathon |2:18:06 |- |1997 |Pan Arab Games |Beirut, Lebanon |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |Marathon |2:28:19 |- |2000 |Olympic Games |Sydney, Australia |38th |Marathon |2:20:33 |} ==References== * *sports-reference Category:1965 births Category:Living people Category:Tunisian male long-distance runners Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1996 Summer Olympics Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2000 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic athletes of Tunisia Category:People from Ben Arous Governorate Category:Tunisian male marathon runners
title: Tahar Mansouri
